Key Match Events: Harry Brook c Markram b Nortje 53 (37b 7x4 0x6 50m) SR: 143.24
Brook brings up first WC fifty Off 35 balls
Baartman gets it wrong Baartman has totally missed his lengths here.
De Kock CAUGHT Will hopefully bring some you images of this soonest but after the lifeline de Kock was given, it's only fitting he has fallen to an amazing catch.
Quinton de Kock's half-century off 22 balls has equalled the fastest fifty of the tournament.
South Africa's second-best PP This has been the second-most productive Powerplay for South Africa at the tournament so far.

SA opening stand shines It's been tough going for the top-order at this World Cup, reflected in the fact that Quinton de Kock and Reeza Hendricks have now gone on to their highest opening stand of the tournament:
First boundaries on the board De Kock has won the early exchange, hitting Moeen down the ground for four, and then six.
Pre-Game Insights: History says South Africa The numbers tell us there's a clear favourite: Overall: Played:25 England:12 South Africa:12 No-Result:1

It's a good day in St Lucia Hello, hello! And welcome to ESPNcricinfo's coverage of what should be an epic Super Eight clash between the defending champions England and the perennial wanna-be champions South Africa.
England bowl, Baartman back for South Africa Jos Buttler put South Africa in on a fresh pitch and anticipates some swing in humid, windy conditions.
Post-Match Reflections: Waka Waka is playing loud and proud in Saint Lucia and I think it's fair to say South Africa will now dare to dream that this is their time.
England by no means out of things. They came close and their NRR remains positive. They play USA and a win there should see them through to the semis.

Props have to go to Quinton de Kock, who set them up so well, and to Keshav Maharaj, for controlling the mid-section of the innings, to Anrich Nortje for bowling a good final over and to Aiden Markram for a second clutch catch in this tournament.
Miscellaneous Highlights: South Africa remain unbeaten at this T20 World Cup and are now 6/6!
Waka Waka is playing loud and proud in Saint Lucia
Others: The DJ is blaring out Fred Again over the speakers but the only people listening are the players, event staff and a handful of journalists.
The boundary dimensions are slightly more even... but that may bring the wind into play even more, and it's currently blowing a gale.
